result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon A Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Upon successful completion of probation, Court will grant expungement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon A Coleman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shannon A Coleman in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 7 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.
Conditions:
*  Pay all costs and surcharges by 08-22-2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment;
*  Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge by 08-22-2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Upon successful completion of probation, Court will grant expungement.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Shannon A Coleman in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shannon A Coleman in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.  The defendant will not change his plea today.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on May 4, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 4.

Defendant Shannon A Coleman in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a plea/sentencing date before the jury trial date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shannon A Coleman in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 21.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services "Court Reminders."  

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Shannon A Coleman in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Shannon A Coleman in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court ordered the January 27, 2016 jury trial date vacated.
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs received, signed, and filed with court.

Defendant Shannon A Coleman in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel received discovery and requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shannon A Coleman in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Daniel Mitchell was not aware of this scheduled court date until today and is not available.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
All other conditions of bail remain in effect.

Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued. Defendant provided orange court date slip with attorney's name on it for a different date than the missed court date. This clerk wrote VOID and wrote initials on old slip to avoid confusion.

Defendant Shannon A Coleman in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Shannon A Coleman not in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Shannon A Coleman in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered stayed warrant lifted. Case adjourned in branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Pretrial conference.  Defense reports that the defendant was in a car accident.  The Court orders bench warrant issued but stayed pending next date.  Calendar call scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shannon A Coleman in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Shannon A Coleman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
